This is version 2 of the file.

Purpose

OFTL algorithm library.

Author

Daniel “q66” Kolesa quak.nosp@m.er66@gmai.nosp@m.l.com

Used libstdc++ and http://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_44_0/libs/type_traits/ doc/html/boost_typetraits/examples/iter.html as reference.

Functions

max

template<typename T> inline T max(T a,
T b)

Returns the largest of the given values.

max

Returns the smallest of the given values.

clamp

template<typename T> inline T clamp(T a,
T b,
T c)

Clamps a given value a into the bounds of b (minimum) and c (maximum).

swap

template<typename T> inline void swap(T &a,
T &b)

Assigns the content of a to b and the content of b to a.

iter_swap

template<typename T, typename U> inline void iter_swap(T a,
U b)

Assigns the content of *a to *b and the content of *b to *a.

Internally does some more checking for proxying iterators.

hash

template<typename T> uint hash(const T &k)

Hashes a type, returning an uint.  For integral numbers, it simply returns them, doing required conversion to unsigned.  For char pointers, it uses bernstein hash, the same for <string>.

The function is undefined for types that are either not integral numbers or strings.

insertion_sort

template<typename T, typename U> inline void insertion_sort(T first,
T last,
U cmp)

Performs an insertion sort on the range given by “first” and “last”, with comparator function defined by “cmp”.  See below for version that doesn’t need “cmp”.

For big ranges, it’s a better idea to use sort.

insertion_sort

template<typename T> inline void insertion_sort(T first,
T last)

An overload that doesn’t require a comparator function and simply uses <sort_cmp> instead.

sort

template<typename T, typename U> inline void sort(T first,
T last,
U cmp)

Sorts a range given by “first” and “last”, with comparator function defined by “cmp”.  See below for version that doesn’t need “cmp”.

Internally, this is a hybrid sorting algorithm, which first uses quicksort with a pivot of median of three if the range is big and when the chunk is 10 elements long or fewer, it performs an insertion_sort which is more efficient in such cases.  You can use this for any general sorting then, because it should be efficient for both small and big ranges.

sort

template<typename T> inline void sort(T first,
T last)

An overload that doesn’t require a comparator function and simply uses <sort_cmp> instead.
